Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a draconian attempt to quash free speech.
The proposal is considered a major threat to freedom of speech and an overreach of government power.
There is skepticism about the government's ability to define misinformation or disinformation accurately.
The legislation lacks a clear definition of 'serious harm,' which is a critical trigger for action.
The bill exempts state and federal governments, allowing them to spread misinformation without consequence.
Notable Quotes: Many have said this is the '…worst piece of legislation for free speech' and will certainly have a '…chilling effect on very important debates'.
How can we trust any government to define for us what misinformation or disinformation is?
The biggest imposition on free speech ever seen in a piece of legislation.
